body.p: Locate on the Mississippi River, about 20 miles north of Hannibal, Missouri. Quincy's founder, John Wood, settled there in 1812. Town named in 1825. Designated the county seat of Adams County, Illinois in 1825. Quincy Land office established in the mid-1830s. During the winter of 1838-1839, five thousand member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Days Saints were driven from their homes in Missouri and arrived in Quincy, where they found temporary shelter on their way to Nauvoo. Beginning in the 1840s, Quincy was a center of underground railroad activity. By the 1850s, Quincy had become Illinois's third largest city, and, in 1853, Congress designated Quincy a port of entry for foreign goods.
